title: So You Have an Eye on Everything Designer But Not the Budget—31 Luxe-Looking Finds That Scratch the Itch
text: Having lived on a fashion budget for years now, I am well-versed in putting together a wardrobe that only looks expensive. Believe it or not, you can get your outfit rotation to give The Row, Khaite, and Toteme vibes without breaking the bank. With a little patience and with focus on the right retailers you can find a plethora of designer-inspired gems that hit the spot. The proof is in my picks below.Ahead, you can peruse my handpicked list of luxe-looking finds that are guaranteed to elevate any outfit, along with some visual outfit inspiration as a guide. I focused on pieces that work best in spring and summer, but there is a selection that can be worn year-round. Included are elevated basics, linen pants and dresses, chic shoes, cool belts, stunning bags, and more. Keep scrolling to shop each piece and thank me later. AQUA East West Medium Shoulder Bag Tell me this doesn't look designer. MANGO Pleat Front Straight Leg Suit Pants Madewell Multi-Keeper Belt A modern take on the classic black belt. Summersalt The Ruched Backflip This swimsuit easily doubles as a chic top. Steve Madden Cary Heeled Sandal Open Edit Cotton Poplin Maxi Skirt So many styling possibilities. H&M Belt-Detail Coated Shopper The tiny buckle makes the bag. H&M Linen-Blend Peplum Jacket This also comes in a rusty-brown color. Selvedge Levi's? Yes, please. J.Crew Drop-Waist Mixy Dress Fifth & Ninth Taya 53mm Polarized Oval Sunglasses H&M Double-Breasted Trench Coat A chic way to carry your essentials. Madewell Triple Metal Keeper Belt J.Crew Wide-Leg Essential Pant in Linen I want these in every color. H&M Knot-Detail Flip-Flops Gap Linen-Blend Square-Neck Maxi Dress Hello, elegant little black dress. Heaven Mayhem Julia Necklace Gap 365 High Rise Linen-Blend Trousers Another chic pair of linen pants. ZARA Faux Leather Bomber Jacket ZARA Asymmetric Soft Suede Mini Bucket Bag Open Edit Tori Kitten Heel Sandal I'll take these in red, black, and white. J.Crew Étienne Oversized Shirt in Lightweight Oxford There's nothing like a crisp white button-down. Gap Vegan Suede Slouchy Tote Bag This faux-suede bag also comes in a rich tan version. Banana Republic Cotton Poplin Smocked-Waist Maxi Skirt This skirt looks so expensive. Models and fashion people alike love this sunglasses style. Gap Linen-Blend Relaxed Straight Ankle Pants These are giving High Sport vibes. AQUA East West Medium Crossbody Bag - Exclusive
html:
Having lived on a fashion budget for years now, I am well-versed in putting together a wardrobe that only looks expensive. Believe it or not, you can get your outfit rotation to give The Row, Khaite, and Toteme vibes without breaking the bank. With a little patience and with focus on the right retailers you can find a plethora of designer-inspired gems that hit the spot. The proof is in my picks below.

Ahead, you can peruse my handpicked list of luxe-looking finds that are guaranteed to elevate any outfit, along with some visual outfit inspiration as a guide. I focused on pieces that work best in spring and summer, but there is a selection that can be worn year-round. Included are elevated basics, linen pants and dresses, chic shoes, cool belts, stunning bags, and more. Keep scrolling to shop each piece and thank me later.
